dc_title_s: Senior Housing: Prince George's County, Maryland
dc_description_s: There are 53 sites, 26 subsidized housing (public) and 27 non-subsidized (private) sites in Prince George's County. There are 6 retirement communities in the County where the age starts at 55 years and older, Cameron Grove, Central Park at Victoria Falls, Collington Life Care Center, Marwood Senior Housing, Riderwood Village, and The Point at Regent Park and all other sites starts at 62 years old.Data is derived from Department of Housing and Community Development, The Housing Authority of Prince George’s County, College Park Housing Authority, The City of Greenbelt and Glenarden Housing Authority. The internet and telephone calls were made to verify each site exists. The information is also available through the Prince George’s County Government, Department of Family Services, aging and Disabilities Services Division.
